[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The International Securities Identification Number (ISIN) defines requirements for automating issuance, amendment, and cancellation to enhance efficiency and compliance at JSE.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ISIN integrates with STRATE's SAFIRES system, financial tools, and analytics platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ISIN provides dashboards and portals for application tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: ISIN operates on JSE's IT infrastructure for cloud and on-premise deployment.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ISIN follows SWIFT protocols for structured data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: ISIN optimizes storage and retrieval for high-volume processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ISIN ensures uptime with failover mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ISIN integrates with reporting and compliance tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 MISSING-TAG2: ISIN supports diverse financial and regulatory environments.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ISIN manages issuance, amendments, and transaction tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for JSE staff, financial analysts, and regulatory teams.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ISIN requires SWIFT connectivity, accurate input, and regulatory approvals.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: ISIN assumes ISO 6166 compliance, SWIFT integration, and SAFIRES compatibility.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: SAFIRES: South African Financial Instrument Registration System.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: SWIFT: Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 MISSING-TAG1: ISIN automates operations, ensuring accuracy, transparency, and financial integration.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall interface with STRATE's SAFIRES system for ISIN issuance.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall use SWIFT MT 598 messages for communication (REQ-FUNC-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall process ISIN requests within 2 minutes using ISO 6166 standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall validate requests before processing (REQ-USAB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall support automated ISIN cancellations.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide dashboards for monitoring ISIN status.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall allow users to view and print ISIN details.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall handle 500 ISIN requests daily.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 100 concurrent users (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The database shall log all ISIN transactions for audits.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall comply with ACID principles (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall adhere to JSE's IT infrastructure standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO 6166 and SWIFT standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale to handle increased request volumes and  maintain 99.9% uptime (REQ-PERF-002).

[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, SWIFT specifications, and troubleshooting guides.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO 6166, SWIFT documentation, and JSE standards.
